contact.feedback: Contact details are clear and complete, including phone, email, and location.

summary.feedback: Summary is concise, highlights technical strengths, and includes relevant accomplishments. Could be improved by mentioning soft skills and career goals.

experience.feedback: No dedicated work experience section; experience is demonstrated through project work. Adding internships or work history would enhance this section.

education.feedback: Education section is present, includes degree names, institutions, and dates. Formatting could be clearer with bullet points or separate lines.

skills.feedback: Technical and soft skills are listed with good organization. Consider grouping or prioritizing most relevant skills for target roles.

projects.feedback: Strong project section with detailed description, tech stack, and impact. Could be expanded with more projects or highlighting specific outcomes.

suggestions: Add Agile methodologies to show familiarity with modern development processes
Include experience with CI/CD or cloud platforms if applicable
Mention unit testing frameworks or Docker for a more robust technical profile

strengths: Strong technical skills in Python, React.js, and AI integration
Demonstrated ability to build and deploy full-stack applications
weaknesses: Lack of formal work experience section
Missing metrics or quantified impacts in project description
Limited mention of methodologies like Agile or testing

rewrittenBullets.original: Developed a full-stack AI web application using Python (FastAPI) and React.js.
rewrittenBullets.improved: Designed and deployed a full-stack AI web application using Python (FastAPI) and React.js, serving over 100 users within the first month.
rewrittenBullets.reason: Adds measurable impact and highlights deployment success.

rewrittenBullets.original: Integrated OpenAI’s GPT-4 API for generating personalized career paths, resume evaluations, and job-role suggestions.
rewrittenBullets.improved: Integrated OpenAI’s GPT-4 API to automate personalized career path generation, resume analysis, and job-role recommendations, reducing manual processing time by 80%.
rewrittenBullets.reason: Quantifies the impact and clarifies automation benefits.

analysis.overallFeedback: This resume demonstrates strong technical skills and project experience, particularly in AI and full-stack web development. The inclusion of a major project helps compensate for limited formal work experience. To improve ATS compatibility and competitiveness, add a dedicated experience section (even for internships or freelance work), quantify project outcomes, and include more keywords relating to Agile, testing, and cloud. Formatting is clear, but separating sections more distinctly will help readability for both ATS and human reviewers.

atsChecklist.item: Uses standard section headings (Experience, Education, Skills)
atsChecklist.tip: Add a dedicated 'Experience' section with clear heading

atsChecklist.item: No tables or complex formatting detected

atsChecklist.tip: Use MM/YYYY format consistently in education and experience

atsChecklist.item: Action verbs used in bullet points

atsChecklist.tip: Add numbers and metrics to bullets
Length is suitable for entry level
Skills are highly relevant to software development roles

suggestions: Break up long technical skill lists with subheadings or bullet points
Add more white space between sections for easier scanning

resumes.textContent: Prasanna Tarle S O F T W A R E D E V E L O P E R +91901283681 | prasannatarlegmail.com | Nashik, India 422201 | P R O F E S S I O N A L O V E R V I E W Detail-oriented web developer with strong communication skills. Experience designing and building user-friendly websites using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and UI/UX design tools like Figma and Adobe. Proven ability to present work to peers and collaborate on development projects. A solution-oriented strategist with a focus on long-term goals and cross-functional collaboration, having the ability to successfully launch, build, and scale brands in competitive industries. P R O J E C T S Project Name :- Phishing Defense Website ● This project is a website designed to help users identify and avoid fake phishing sites. ● The project was well received for its innovative approach to tackle Phishing attack. ● As the design lead, I created the website's layout, ensuring it was user-friendly and visually appealing with tools like HTML, JavaScript and CSS and other tools like Figma for UI part. T E C H N I C A L S K I L L S  HTML  CSS  JavaScript  Java  Figma (UI/UX)  JIRA (Project Management) S O F T S K I L L S  Communication  Problem Solving  Stress Management  Decision making C O R E C O M P E T E N C Y  DBMS  Computer Network  operating System E D U C A T I O N K.K Wagh Polytechnic | Nashik , Maharashtra| Diploma in Computer Technology Sandip University | Nashik, Maharashtra | B-Tech

contact.feedback: Contact information is mostly present and clear, but the email is missing the '@' symbol. Consider using a standard format and adding LinkedIn if available.

summary.feedback: A short professional overview is included and highlights relevant skills and approach. Can be improved by tailoring more closely to desired roles and quantifying achievements.

experience.feedback: No dedicated professional work experience section is present. Only projects are described. Consider adding internships, freelance, or part-time experiences.

education.feedback: Education section lists both diploma and degree with institution names and locations. Add years of graduation for completeness.

skills.feedback: Technical, soft, and core competency skills are listed. Consolidate under clear headings and add more role-specific or in-demand skills if possible.

projects.feedback: Project section is present with a detailed description of a relevant project. Add more projects or provide more metrics/impact if possible.

suggestions: Add 'React' or another popular JavaScript framework if you have experience.
Include 'Git' or 'Version Control' in your skills to show modern development practices.
Mention 'Agile' or other development methodologies if relevant.
Add 'REST API' and 'Testing' if you have experience with these areas.

strengths: Strong foundation in front-end technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript)
Relevant project experience with a security focus
weaknesses: Missing key technical keywords for modern web development roles (e.g., React, Git, Agile)
Contact information format could be improved

rewrittenBullets.original: The project was well received for its innovative approach to tackle Phishing attack.
rewrittenBullets.improved: Received positive feedback for designing an innovative website that educates users on identifying and avoiding phishing attacks.
rewrittenBullets.reason: Combines achievement with clear impact and uses active language.

rewrittenBullets.original: As the design lead, I created the website's layout, ensuring it was user-friendly and visually appealing with tools like HTML, JavaScript and CSS and other tools like Figma for UI part.
rewrittenBullets.improved: Led the design and development of a user-friendly website interface using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and Figma, enhancing usability and visual appeal.
rewrittenBullets.reason: More concise, highlights leadership, and lists key technologies.

analysis.overallFeedback: This resume demonstrates a solid foundation in front-end web development and UI/UX design, with strong soft skills and a detailed project. However, it lacks a dedicated work experience section, which is important even at the entry level (internships, freelance, or volunteering can be included). The skills section could be expanded with more in-demand technologies and methodologies like version control (Git), frameworks (React), and Agile development. Contact details should be formatted more professionally. Clarify section headings, add quantifiable achievements, and consider including more projects or relevant coursework for a stronger ATS and recruiter impact.

atsChecklist.tip: Add a dedicated 'Experience' section and standardize all headings for better ATS recognition

Use bullet points for skills and experience for better readability

messages.content:
Absolutely! The **AI & tech landscape** is evolving rapidly. Here are the **top AI & tech careers projected to be in high demand by 2026**, including required skills and why they matter.

---

# 🚀 Top AI & Tech Careers in 2026

## 1. **AI/Machine Learning Engineer**
- **What they do:** Design, build, and deploy AI models and algorithms.
- **Skills:** Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, data science, math/stats, cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure).
- **Why:** AI adoption is accelerating across all industries.

---

## 2. **Data Scientist / Data Engineer**
- **What they do:** Analyze, interpret, and manage large data sets to drive business decisions.
- **Skills:** SQL, Python/R, big data tools (Spark, Hadoop), data visualization, statistics.
- **Why:** Businesses need data insights to stay competitive.

---

## 3. **Cybersecurity Analyst/Engineer**
- **What they do:** Protect systems and data from cyber threats.
- **Skills:** Network security, ethical hacking, incident response, security tools (SIEM, IDS/IPS), certifications (CISSP, CEH).
- **Why:** Cyber threats keep increasing as technology advances.

---

## 4. **Cloud Solutions Architect**
- **What they do:** Design and implement scalable cloud solutions.
- **Skills:** Cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP), infrastructure as code (Terraform, CloudFormation), DevOps.
- **Why:** Cloud computing continues to dominate IT infrastructure.

---

## 5. **AI Product Manager**
- **What they do:** Lead the development of AI-powered products from concept to launch.
- **Skills:** Product management, AI concepts, business strategy, user experience, project management.
- **Why:** Bridging business and AI tech is increasingly important.

---

## 6. **Robotics Engineer**
- **What they do:** Design and build robots and automation systems.
- **Skills:** Mechatronics, programming (C++, Python, ROS), sensor integration, control systems.
- **Why:** Automation and robotics use is expanding in manufacturing, logistics, and healthcare.

---

## 7. **Full Stack Developer (AI/ML focus)**
- **What they do:** Build end-to-end web applications with AI/ML components.
- **Skills:** Frontend & backend frameworks, APIs, AI libraries, cloud deployment.
- **Why:** AI-powered applications are becoming mainstream.

---

## 8. **AI Ethics Specialist**
- **What they do:** Ensure AI systems are fair, transparent, and ethical.
- **Skills:** AI/ML basics, law, philosophy, policy, risk assessment.
- **Why:** Societal trust in AI depends on responsible development.

---

## 9. **Edge Computing Engineer**
- **What they do:** Develop systems that process data locally on devices (“at the edge”).
- **Skills:** IoT, embedded systems, AI/ML, networking.
- **Why:** Edge computing is critical for real-time applications (autonomous vehicles, smart devices).

---

## 10. **Quantum Computing Specialist**
- **What they do:** Research and develop applications for quantum processors.
- **Skills:** Quantum theory, programming (Q#, Qiskit), math, physics.
- **Why:** Quantum computing is an emerging field with disruptive potential.

---

# 🌟 Tips to Prepare

- **Start learning now:** Use online courses (Coursera, Udemy, edX), bootcamps, and certifications.
- **Build a portfolio:** Showcase projects on GitHub or personal websites.
- **Network:** Join tech communities (LinkedIn groups, hackathons, meetups).
- **Stay updated:** Follow tech news, research papers, and AI/tech leaders.
- **Sharpen soft skills:** Communication, problem-solving, teamwork, and adaptability are crucial.

---

**Curious about a specific career or need advice on how to break into one of these roles? Let me know!**
Start a mock behavioral interview for a mid-level Software Engineer position. Ask the FIRST question only. Be professional.

Certainly! Here’s your first behavioral interview question:

---

**Question 1:**  
Can you describe a time when you had to quickly learn a new technology or tool to complete a project? Walk me through how you approached the situation and the outcome.

---

Please take your time to answer.

sessions.title: Most in-demand skills for remote work

messages.content: Most in-demand skills for remote work

Absolutely! Remote work opportunities have grown rapidly, and certain skills are especially valued by employers seeking remote talent. Here’s a breakdown of the **most in-demand skills for remote work** in 2024:

---

## 1. **Digital Communication**
- **Why it matters:** Remote teams rely heavily on clear, concise, and professional communication.
- **Tools to master:** Slack, Zoom, Microsoft Teams, email etiquette.

## 2. **Self-Management & Time Management**
- **Why it matters:** Without direct supervision, employers need people who can prioritize and deliver independently.
- **Key skills:** Task prioritization, scheduling, accountability, goal setting.

## 3. **Tech Savviness**
- **Why it matters:** Remote jobs require comfort with digital tools and troubleshooting minor tech issues.
- **Tools to master:** Google Workspace, project management software, cloud storage.

## 4. **Project Management**
- **Why it matters:** Coordinating tasks and deadlines is essential in distributed teams.
- **Popular tools:** Trello, Asana, Jira, Monday.com.

## 5. **Written Communication**
- **Why it matters:** Most remote work relies on written updates, reports, and documentation.
- **Develop:** Clear, persuasive, and error-free writing.

## 6. **Collaboration**
- **Why it matters:** Teamwork is just as important remotely.
- **How to show:** Experience with cross-functional teams, collaborative software, or agile methods.

## 7. **Problem-Solving & Critical Thinking**
- **Why it matters:** Employers value those who can handle challenges independently and propose solutions.

## 8. **Adaptability & Flexibility**
- **Why it matters:** Remote work environments change rapidly—adaptation is key.

## 9. **Technical Skills (Job-Specific)**
- **Examples:**
    - **Software Development:** Git, GitHub, Python, JavaScript, APIs
    - **Digital Marketing:** SEO, Google Analytics, social media ads, content creation
    - **Design:** Adobe Creative Suite, Figma, UX/UI principles
    - **Customer Support:** CRM tools, helpdesk software

## 10. **Cybersecurity Awareness**
- **Why it matters:** Protecting company data is crucial with remote access.

---

### **Action Steps to Build These Skills**
1. **Take Online Courses:** [Coursera](https://www.coursera.org/), [LinkedIn Learning](https://www.linkedin.com/learning/), and [Udemy](https://www.udemy.com/) offer courses on all these skills.
2. **Practice Using Tools:** Set up mock projects using Trello, Slack, or Google Docs.
3. **Showcase on Resume:** Highlight remote-friendly skills and tools in your resume and LinkedIn.
4. **Get Certified:** Certifications in project management (PMP, Scrum), digital marketing (Google), or tech (AWS, CompTIA) add credibility.
5. **Seek Remote Internships/Volunteering:** Gain experience with distributed teams.

---

### **Encouragement**
Remote work rewards those who are proactive, communicative, and open to learning. By focusing on these skills, you’ll stand out to remote employers and unlock a world of flexible work opportunities! 🚀

If you want suggestions tailored to a specific field, let me know!
Start a mock behavioral interview for a mid-level Software Engineer position. Ask the FIRST question only. Be professional.

Certainly! Let’s begin.

**Question 1:**  
Can you describe a time when you had to work closely with a team to deliver a project under a tight deadline? What was your role, and how did you ensure the project was completed successfully?

result.title: Remote AI Engineer Career Path
result.summary: This career path is designed for B.Tech graduates with Python and machine learning skills aspiring to become remote AI engineers. It focuses on building strong foundations in AI concepts, practical experience through projects, and continuous upskilling to stay competitive in the fast-evolving AI landscape.

timeline.title: Foundation
goals: Strengthen Python programming and core machine learning concepts
Build foundational math skills (linear algebra, calculus, probability)
milestones: Completed at least three machine learning projects (e.g., regression, classification, clustering)
Solid understanding of ML theory and Python libraries

timeline.title: Growth
goals: Deepen knowledge in deep learning and neural networks
milestones: Built and deployed at least one deep learning model (e.g., image or text classifier)
Contributed to open-source or team-based AI projects

timeline.title: Professionalization
goals: Specialize in a subdomain (NLP, Computer Vision, MLOps, etc.)
Gain experience with cloud AI services (AWS/GCP/Azure)
Contribute to research, publish articles, or present at online conferences
skills: Cloud deployment (AWS SageMaker, GCP AI Platform)
milestones: Developed and deployed an end-to-end AI solution on the cloud
Built a strong online AI portfolio (GitHub, personal website, publications)

topRoles.title: AI Engineer
topRoles.description: Designs, builds, and deploys AI models and solutions for various applications.

topRoles.title: Machine Learning Engineer
topRoles.description: Focuses on implementing and optimizing machine learning models in production environments.

topRoles.title: Data Scientist (AI Focus)
topRoles.description: Analyzes complex data and builds predictive AI models to solve business problems.

skillGaps: Software engineering best practices for AI

alternativePaths.title: Data Engineer
alternativePaths.description: Focuses on building data pipelines and infrastructure to support AI and analytics projects; ideal for those who enjoy data architecture and large-scale systems.

alternativePaths.title: MLOps Engineer
alternativePaths.description: Specializes in automating and streamlining the deployment and monitoring of machine learning models, combining AI and DevOps skills.

alternativePaths.title: AI Researcher
alternativePaths.description: Works on cutting-edge AI algorithms and theoretical advancements, suitable for those interested in academia or R&D.

networkingTips: Actively participate in online AI communities (LinkedIn, Twitter, GitHub, Reddit ML/AI forums).
Attend virtual AI conferences, webinars, and remote hackathons to connect with professionals and recruiters.
recommendations: Continuously update your portfolio with real-world AI projects and contributions to open-source repositories.
Stay current with AI trends by subscribing to top newsletters (e.g., The Batch by DeepLearning.AI) and engaging with research papers.

result.title: MERN Stack Developer Career Path
result.summary: This career path is tailored for a fresher with a diploma, JavaScript and React skills, and a keen interest in the MERN (MongoDB, Express, React, Node.js) stack. The journey is structured to build a strong foundation in backend and full-stack development, leading to junior and eventually senior MERN developer roles, while filling in key skill gaps and leveraging certifications for employability.

timeline.title: Foundation
goals: Master core JavaScript concepts and advanced React
Learn HTML, CSS, and responsive design
Get introduced to Node.js and MongoDB basics
milestones: Build and deploy 2-3 responsive React applications
Complete a basic CRUD app using Node.js and MongoDB

timeline.title: Growth
goals: Gain proficiency with the entire MERN stack
Understand RESTful API design and authentication
Work on real-world projects or internships
milestones: Develop and deploy a full-stack MERN project with authentication
Contribute to open-source or freelance MERN projects

timeline.title: Professional Development
goals: Refine advanced MERN skills and best practices
Learn testing, CI/CD, and cloud deployment
Prepare for mid-level/senior roles and technical interviews
milestones: Deploy a production-ready MERN app with testing and CI/CD
Land a full-time MERN developer role or promotion

certifications.name: Full-Stack Web Development with React Specialization

topRoles.title: Junior MERN Stack Developer
topRoles.description: Works on building and maintaining full-stack web applications using MongoDB, Express, React, and Node.js under supervision.

topRoles.title: Full-Stack JavaScript Developer
topRoles.description: Builds scalable web applications across the stack, often on agile teams, and contributes to both frontend and backend architecture.

topRoles.title: Senior MERN Stack Engineer
topRoles.description: Leads design and development of large-scale MERN applications, mentors juniors, and drives adoption of best practices and emerging tech.

skillGaps: Backend development with Node.js and Express
Database design and management with MongoDB

alternativePaths.title: Front-End Developer (React Specialist)
alternativePaths.description: Focuses exclusively on advanced React and UI/UX, suitable for those who prefer client-side development.

alternativePaths.title: Back-End Node.js Developer
alternativePaths.description: Specializes in server-side development with Node.js and Express, ideal if backend work is more interesting.

alternativePaths.title: Mobile App Developer (React Native)
alternativePaths.description: Leverages React skills to build cross-platform mobile apps; great for those interested in mobile technologies.

networkingTips: Contribute to open-source MERN projects or join GitHub communities to showcase your code and connect with industry professionals.
Attend local or virtual JavaScript/React/MERN meetups and tech conferences to expand your professional network.
recommendations: Work on hands-on MERN stack projects and build a strong project portfolio to demonstrate your practical skills.
Stay updated with emerging JavaScript and cloud technologies by following thought leaders and participating in online developer communities.

projects.description: Apply learned skills in a real-world project

projects.title: Contribute to open source in System Design
Build a full stack developer project
